NEW YORK UNIVERSITY     ARTS AND SCIENCE     COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE     GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                 Home     People       Undergraduate Program       Graduate Program       Courses       News       Events       Publications       Student Testimonials       Alumni       Visiting Scholars       Employment             Stay Connected           Listserv       Facebook       Twitter               NYU's Center for European and Mediterranean Studies (CEMS) serves as the University's interdisciplinary hub for teaching, research, and programming on Europe—from both a historical and contemporary perspective. With a primary focus on teaching, CEMS offers a B.A. degree (Major and Minor in European Studies), M.A. degree, and doctoral support for Ph.D. candidates in related disciplines from across the university. CEMS also maintains an active calendar of workshops, lectures, and conference, many of which are open to the public. In addition to CEMS, NYU houses eight institutes exclusively concerned with European studies: Glucksman Ireland House , Deutsches Haus , the Institute of French Studies , La Maison Française , the Jean Monnet Center at the Law School , Casa Italiana , the Remarque Institute , and the King Juan Carlos I of Spain Center .     Upcoming Events       Monday, May 4, 12:30 p.m.     Katrina Forrester "Rules, Persons, and Society"         Friday, May 8, 4:30 p.m.     Ermira Danaj "Exploring Practices and Strategies of Women"           Complete List of Events           Prospective Students         GSAS Admissions           Graduate FAQ           GSAS Application Resource Center           Undergraduate Admissions and Application           Undergraduate FAQ           B.A./M.A. Program           GSAS/CAS Tuition Program             Announcements         CEMS Student Wins Marc Bloch Award           Student Achievements                         Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science

International Clearing House for Endangered Languages       Refugee Research Network (REFWORLD)   From the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees' Centre for Documentation and Research (CDR).       The Virtual Library on Migration and Ethnic Relations              Public Opinion Polls        Eurobarometer   Eurobarometer polls are official European public opinion surveys which have been conducted since 1973 and are presently undertaken by the European Commission Directorate General 10. Interviews are carried out on behalf of particular DGs and EU institutions between two to five times a year with six monthly reports.       European Society for Opinion and Marketing Research   The European Society for Opinion and Marketing Research (ESOMAR) is recognized throughout the world as the leading organization for suppliers and users of market research. Membership in ESOMAR is open to all persons who are actively involved in, or concerned with, the science of marketing, and market and opinion research. The site includes information on how ESOMAR functions, details of events, membership, publications, and access to the ESOMAR directory of research organizations.       ICM Research Poll Reviews   Description: The ICM site provides access to opinion polls from the Guardian, Scotsman and Evening Standard from 1997 to date. These include the results of political opinion polls showing the level of support of British political parties during the 2001 election campaigns and seat projections based on recent polls. They also include coverage of social issues such as support for the European Union.       MORI Opinion Polls Archive   MORI is an international market and opinion research organization. Its web page contains the results of its recent surveys, many of which are related to political opinions. There are examples of specific subject areas, as well as a chronological listing of polls. The spectrum of subject areas for the polls is diverse, talking in such areas as attitudes towards Europe, education and voting intentions. The range of these polls covers most areas of society and tends to focus on the United Kingdom.       Question Bank   Description: The Question Bank holds copies of questionnaires used in a number of major British social surveys. This resource is produced by the Centre for Applied Social Surveys (CASS) with the University of Surrey. All questionnaires are in Adobe Acrobat (PDF) format and can be searched by topic or keyword.       Your Voice In Europe   Description: Your Voice in Europe is an interactive citizen's site, which has been created by the European Commission to encourage public participation in EU politics. It includes news from the European Union, information on contacting officials and registering complaints, links to recent consultation documents covering all aspects of economic, social and political policy and information about recent opinion polls. The site also supports regular email discussion forums. Typical issues covered include: European Union enlargement, integration and the single European Currency. The site is offered in all the main languages of the EU- including English, French, German, Italian and Spanish. Undergraduate Program    |     Center for European and Mediterranean Studies    | New York University                                   Skip to page Content.     NEW YORK UNIVERSITY     ARTS AND SCIENCE     COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE     GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                Home       People     Undergraduate Program              Major              Minor              BA/MA              Internship Packet         Graduate Program       Courses       News       Events       Publications       Student Testimonials       Alumni       Visiting Scholars       Employment             Stay Connected           Listserv       Facebook       Twitter               Related Information         Hellenic Studies           Undergraduate Admissions and Application           Undergraduate Program Forms                 Home > Undergraduate Program     Undergraduate Program   The Center for European and Mediterranean Studies offers an interdisciplinary major and minor in European and Mediterranean studies focusing on contemporary patterns of politics, culture, and society as well as on historical development in Europe. Both the major and minor are designed for students seeking pre-professional training for careers in international business and finance, diplomacy, international law, and cultural organizations dealing with Europe. Although open to all students, the minor is especially suited to majors in European languages, history, or the social sciences.    Undergraduates who are matriculated in the College of Arts and Science may also consider the B.A./M.A. program --   an opportunity to earn both the bachelor's degree and the master's   degree in a shorter period of time and at less cost than is normally the   case. Read about the GSAS/CAS Tuition Program , which involves a 25% tuition discount. Undergraduate Frequently Asked Questions                     Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science
